sentence.Network_en: We all start with preconceived notions of what we want from life.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们开始时都对自己想从生活中得到什么抱有一些预想。

sentence.Network_en: Like most "peacetime wars" it did not conform to preconceived ideas.
sentence.Network_cn: 如同大多数“和平时代的战争”一样，这与我们的预想不同。

sentence.Network_en: Before I started the job, I had no preconceived notions of what it would be like.
sentence.Network_cn: 开始做这工作之前，我并未预想过它的实际情况。

entry.tran: （观点）事先形成的，先入为主的
entry.def: If you have preconceived ideas about something, you have already formed an opinion about it before you have enough information or experience.

example.ex: Five minutes after he had arrived for the interview, I had abandoned my preconceived ideas about boxers...
example.tran: 他到达采访地点不过5分钟，我就摒弃了自己对拳击手的那些成见。

example.ex: We all start with preconceived notions of what we want from life.
example.tran: 我们开始时都对自己想从生活中得到什么抱有一些预想。

means.word_mean: 1. (of an idea or opinion) formed beforehand; especially without evidence or through prejudice;
